column4: I have been trying for four hours to get madwifi installed so that my wifi works in Ubuntu. I'm a newbie and the documents seem to go in circles. Can one install madwifi via synapse?
no, it just means ubotu isn't as omniscient as we expected it to be. activate multiverse repos, search for linux-restricted-modules and install the package that fits your kernel.
well, i am using a pcmcia "Atheros Communications, Inc. AR5212 802.11abg NIC (rev 01)" right now
run 'dmesg', see if anything suspicious comes up, or just pastebin it
hm, strange. is it an internal pci card?
MrRio: ndiswrapper is probably the best way currently, or you would have to recompile madwifi at least
usually most drivers for the same chipset work, but it's safest and easiest to get the correct drivers
a simple reboot might be worth a try, madwifi drivers are likely still loaded and could be interfering, add 'blacklist ath_pci' to /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist
and make sure the device id in 'lspci -n' matches the driver's id in /etc/ndiswrapper/blah/<id>.conf or so
check with lsmod if ndiswrapper is loaded, if it is, have a look at dmesg, if it doesn't say anything exciting your windows driver probably doesn't have the correct device id
